item.title: PLACEMENT ROADMAP
item.author: hariprasathcce@gmail.com (Hariprasath)
item.description: Aptitude Placement Training is enough for aptitude. Additional Resources : Aptitude book: RS Agarwal Programming Learn the programming language (Java, Python) in w3schools or Youtube. Then Practice problems in HackerRank Alogrithms , HackerRank DS(Preferred) or Leetcode. Easy to Medium Level programming problems are enough to learn. Cheatsheets ZOHO - https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/interview-experiences/zoho-interview-questions-and-answers-for-technical-profiles/ Cognizant - https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/dsa/cognizant-sde-sheet-interview-questions-and-answers/ Kaar - https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/interview-experiences/kaar-technologies-interview-experience/ TCS - https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/dsa/tcs-sde-sheet-interview-questions-and-answers/

item.title: Crack the Gate 1 - picoCtf
item.author: hariprasathcce@gmail.com (Hariprasath)
item.description: Challenge Name - Crack the Gate 1 - picoCtf Category Web Exploitation Difficulty: Easy Description Weâ€™re in the middle of an investigation. One of our persons of interest, ctf player, is believed to be hiding sensitive data inside a restricted web portal. Weâ€™ve uncovered the email address he uses to log in:Â ctf-player@picoctf.org. Unfortunately, we donâ€™t know the password, and the usual guessing techniques havenâ€™t worked. But something feels off… itâ€™s almost like the developer left a secret way in.

item.title: Flag in Flame - picoCtf
item.author: hariprasathcce@gmail.com (Hariprasath)
item.description: Challenge Name - Flag in Flame - picoCtf Category:Forensics Difficulty:Easy Description The SOC team discovered a suspiciously large log file after a recent breach. When they opened it, they found an enormous block of encoded text instead of typical logs. Could there be something hidden within? Your mission is to inspect the resulting file and reveal the real purpose of it. The team is relying on your skills to uncover any concealed information within this unusual log.

item.title: Hidden in plainsight - picoCtf
item.author: hariprasathcce@gmail.com (Hariprasath)
item.description: Challenge Name - Hidden in plainsight - picoCtf Category: Forensics Difficulty: Easy Description Youâ€™re given a seemingly ordinary JPG image. Something is tucked away out of sight inside the file. Your task is to discover the hidden payload and extract the flag.Download the jpg imageÂ here. Hints Download the jpg image and read its metadata Step-by-Step Solution First when I download the image, I saw its metadata using exiftool. ExifTool Version Number : 13.

item.title: Log Hunt - PicoCtf
item.author: hariprasathcce@gmail.com (Hariprasath)
item.description: Challenge Name - Log Hunt- picoMini by CMU-Africa Category: General Difficulty: Easy Description Our server seems to be leaking pieces of a secret flag in its logs. The parts are scattered and sometimes repeated. Can you reconstruct the original flag?Download theÂ logsÂ and figure out the full flag from the fragments. Hints You can useÂ grepÂ to filter only matching lines from the log. Some lines are duplicates; ignore extra occurrences.

Amidst the chaos lies a hidden treasureâ€”an elusive flag waiting to be uncovered.Find the PDF file hereÂ Hidden Confidential DocumentÂ and uncover the flag within the metadata The pdf file provided:

item.author: hariprasathcce@gmail.com (Hariprasath)
item.description: Element with Left side smaller than Right side greater Input : [4, 2, 5, 7] output : 5 Create two array, leftMax and rightMin Assing rightMin[n - 1] to max value (Integer.MAX_VALUE In a for loop from i = 1, assign the leftMax[i] = Math.max(leftMax[i - 1], arr[i - 1]) In a for loop from i = n - 2, assign the RightMin[i] = Math.min(rightMin[i + 1], arr[i + 1]) then return the element that is arr[i] > leftMax[i] && arr[i] < rightMin[i] Sorting Elements of an Array by Frequency Explanation: Given an arrayÂ A[]Â of integers,Â sortÂ the array according toÂ frequencyÂ of elements.

item.author: hariprasathcce@gmail.com (Hariprasath)
item.description: Time Complexity Big O Notation Big O notation is special notation that tells you how fast an algorithm is. Big O notation is about the worst-case scenario. Itâ€™s a reassuranceâ€”you know that simple search will never be slower than O(n) time. Algorithm running times grow at diï¬€erent rates This tells you the number of operations an algorithm will make. Itâ€™s called Big O Notation because you put a â€œbig Oâ€ in front of the number of operations O(log n), also known as log time.

item.author: hariprasathcce@gmail.com (Hariprasath)
item.description: Travel Salesman Problem (TSP) Explanation: Given aÂ 2d matrix cost[][]Â ofÂ size nÂ whereÂ cost[i][j]Â denotes the cost of moving fromÂ city i to city j.Â The task is to complete aÂ tourÂ fromÂ city 0 (0-based index)Â to all other cities such that we visit each cityÂ exactly onceÂ and then at the end come back toÂ city 0Â at minimum cost. Find the minimum possible cost to visit every city exactly once and return to the starting city.
